summary: AT APPROXIMATELY 38,000 MILES, I BEGAN EXPERIENCING OCCASIONAL HUMMING NOISES AND LOCK UP OF MY ABS BRAKES.  AT 42,000 MILES MY ABS BRAKES WENT OFF WHILE CROSSING AN INTERSECTION IN THE RAIN AND WOULD NOT GO OFF.  I WAS FORCED TO REMOVE THE FUSE FOR THE ABS TO SHUTOFF THE PUMP AND THEREFORE NO LONGER HAVE SAFETY BENEFIT OF ANTI-LOCK BRAKES. I HAVE SIX OTHER FRIENDS WHO HAVE HAD THE EXACT SAME PROBLEMS UNDER SIMILAR WEATHER CONDITIONS.  IF THIS IS AS COMMON A PROBLEM AS IT APPEARS TO BE, WHY HASN'T THE NHTSA GONE AFTER CHEVROLET TO FIX THIS POTENTIALLY LIFE-THREATENING PROBLEM.  I'M SURE A SURVEY OF CHEVROLET OWNERS WOULD PROVIDE A WEALTH OF INFORMATION AS TO THE EXTENT OF THIS PROBLEM.  BC     *NLM
